subject: Re: [unclassified] [junit] fileset wildcard question
msgSnippet: ... This seems a little off-topic. Try reading the manual [1] - the core types haven t changed too much over the last year or so, or posting to the ant-users
messageBody:
On 01/08/05, vpham2000 <vpham@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks to all who answered my question.
> My batchtest with **/*Test.class failed
> because i have put all my classes in sipenum package
> which **/*Test.class could not find. I found other way
> to filter it out correctly.
>
> I have another question about using fileset :
> if i compile my test cases and put them
> in separate directories, how can i build a jar file
> that contains all my test cases classes from all my test
> subdirectories.
>
> for example:
> my test directory output structure looks like this:
>
> /build/test/gtt/soap/wps
> and
> /build/test/naptr/soap/wps
>
> All my test cases are in package /soap/wps.
>
> I compile my test cases and put them in ${build.test.dir}/naptr
> ${build.test.dir}/gtt subdirectories.
>
> <target name="compilenaptr" depends="compile">
> <mkdir dir="${build.test.dir}/naptr"/>
> <javac debug="true" includeAntRuntime="yes" srcdir="${test.dir}"
> destdir="${build.test.dir}/naptr" >
> <classpath refid="project.classpath" />
> <include name="**/*NAPTR*Test*.java" />
> </javac>
> </target>
> <target name="compilegtt" depends="compile">
> <mkdir dir="${build.test.dir}/gtt"/>
> <javac debug="true" includeAntRuntime="yes" srcdir="${test.dir}"
> destdir="${build.test.dir}/gtt" >
> <classpath refid="project.classpath" />
> <include name="**/*GTT*Test*.java" />
> </javac>
> </target>
>
> I would like to build a jar file using ant that contains
> only /soap/wps/*.classes from both ${build.test.dir}/naptr
> and ${build.test.dir}/gtt
>
> I tried the ant code below but the jar file also pick up
> the top level directories /build/test/naptr and
> /build/test/gtt which I don't want. I only want from /soap/wps/
> level downward.
>
> <target name="jar" depends="compiletests">
> <mkdir dir="build/lib"/>
> <jar jarfile="build/lib/alltest.jar" compress="true">
> <fileset dir="build/test" includes="**/*.class"/>
> </jar>
> </target>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> > vpham2000 wrote:
> > > junit and ant newbie question, please help
> > >
> > > what is the difference between
> > > **/*Test.class vs *Test.class
> >
> > **/*Test.class means "any file ending in Test.class anywhere below
> me in
> > the directory structure"
> >
> > *Test.class means "any file ending in Test.class in the current
> > directory only"
> > --
> > J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> > Diaspar Software Services
> > http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> > Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------
> YAHOO! GROUPS LINKS

This seems a little off-topic.

Try reading the manual [1] - the core types haven't changed too much over
the last year or so, or posting to the ant-users list if that doesn't
provide enough help [2].

[1] http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTypes/fileset.html
[2] http://ant.apache.org/mail.html
